hero.title: Understanding
hero.subtitle: User Personas
hero.tagline: The Beginning of the User-Centric Approach

info_graphic_band.header: Deeply understanding users is fundamental to creating an exceptional experience
info_graphic_band.text: Too often in projects, we define our business goals full of optimism, but invest little time into developing insights into what our users are looking for -- their unmet needs. This often leads to inaccurate expectations of the work and the outcomes, causing key issues to be missed or problems to be identified until it's too late in the process. Without understanding for whom we are building products, our teams can erroneously make assumptions that often knock us off course of meeting the unmet needs of the user and ensuring business success.

items.text: Build Empathy It isn't enough to gather data on users. When you create a persona, you are crafting the lens through which the user sees. Through that lens, you understand what he or she is feeling, wanting and needing. Everyone on the project, whether they are business, creative, technical, marketing, or sales, needs to be emotionally connected to the user.

Develop Focus Most times, a project needs to address different types of users. By recognizing and identifying the primary user, you begin to lay the foundation of your core features for him/her, and develop a clear set of priorities and goals. If you design for everyone, you are designing for no one.

Make and Defend Decisions When you see the world from your userâ€™s perspective, then determining what is useful and what is an edge case becomes a lot easier. When a design choice is brought into question, defending it based on real data and research on users is the best way to show others the logical and user-focused reasoning behind the decision.

Recognize the Limitations of Your Persona In reality, oftentimes we cannot always fully build a comprehensive profile due to time and resources. By making it clear of the unknowns, you set a realistic expectation of the scope of work for everyone in order to plan for an efficient short-term solution while not sacrificing the long-term vision.
